review_title: Tough building due to level of care needed, but very rewarding and a family-like environment
pros: Residents are great! Family-like environment, $2 meals, can gain a lot of nursing stills, promotes within, 12 hr. shifts and 4 days off a week!
cons: Busy days, runs as a nursing home but is more like a PCU.

pros: residents were amazing to be with and work with
cons: Corporate office doesn't listen to others

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in North Tazewell, VA
cons: I will not comment on this

pros: Great company to work for, fair pay, 40 hours a week, 30 minute lunch break

review_title: The most dedicated and compassionate people I've ever met
job_title: Human Resources Manager in Roanoke, VA
pros: Collaborative, Smart, Experienced, Compassionate, Trustworthy, Inclusive
cons: Everyone has occasional disorganization and we're no different but that's the only similarity with most companies.

review_title: Toxic and severe micromanagement environment from senior upper management
pros: Medical Director is awesome and cares about residents and staff
cons: Senior upper management insists on local upper management to use autocratic leadership style instead of a nurturing and educational approach for employees.  Local upper management  ( DON and Administrators) have no autonomy since every decision must first go through senior upper management daily. This  includes nurses documentation on residents and all admission referrals need to be reviewed and approved by senior upper management.  This causes much chaos,  stress and decreased morale of employees.  Everything is subjective to senior upper management including raises and employee reviews.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Warm Springs, VA
cons: Out of date or broken equipment. Inadequate supplies.

pros: pay, all the hours you want
cons: Understaffed, all upper management are family, change rules daily and don’t tell anyone and then yell at them when they don’t adhere to new rule
Never paid bills on time, no raises, no room for growth
